page.title: 07The Whitechapel Bell Foundry
page.content: Some of the character of our square was lost in the ammenity count. For example, the Whitechapel Bell Foundry had to be recorded as "Metal Manufacturing Works" whilst it is in fact one of the oldest and most famous bell foundries in the world. It can claim an uninterrupted descent from one Robert Mot who was Master Founder over 400 years ago. He himself was one of a line of master founders going back to Robert Chamberlain (some of whose bells still survive) who was active in Aldgate as early as 1420. Thus the foundry boasts a continuous succession spanning more than 5 centuries. Some of the famous bells cast are:- the Liberty Bell, 1752; Big Ben, 1858 and the American Bicentennial Bell, 1976.
